column4: you should have really split your filesystem across partitions before you installed.
What do you mean?
i typically mount the /home directory on its own partition... wichi means any future clean installs i simply specify in the installer that it should use the home folder already at that partition
but it's something you need to prepare for before installing
Ah I see. But what of /var/www? and other such folders.
on my webservers i mount /var on a very large partition too
you're not going to get that without alot of effort
Well going forward that is certainly something to consider.
Really? I only intend to do this once
unless of course you simply use clonezilla
What's that?
clonezilla is the opensource alternative to nortons ghost
Oh I used that recently. It worked excellently.
if you upgrade you wont't be able to rollback
Unless I use clonezilla?
well yes creating a snapshot of a device or partition gives you that final garuntee
if you are thinking about moving to maverick you need to ask yourself do you need it for vanity or practical requirements for the webserver (also remember the mantra about early adpoters )

And that's the very reason I'm keeping myself back. I just thought that as someone who is actively using quickly and stuff to develop applications for Ubuntu (as a fledgling developer) that I would benefit from using the latest-and-greatest.
vanity sake.. I already use the font and themes :)
for that i recommend simply using virtualbox to run the bleedingedge
Right. I use virtualbox a lot.
